message.content:
{"id": "7330", 
 "title": "Bug 7330: Make more actions available on text selection", 
 "description": "I could not find the action 'Add Javadoc Comment' until I switched to the Outline view. Currently, the actions are distributed in a way that is not clear to users. Some actions are in the context menu and some are not, which forces users to switch views to access certain actions. This should be changed to make all actions reachable from the editor.", 
 "OB": "The action 'Add Javadoc Comment' should be available in the context menu.", 
 "EB": "I expected the action 'Add Javadoc Comment' to be available in the context menu.", 
 "SR": "Ensure that the action 'Add Javadoc Comment' is included in the context menu options for text selection."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '7330', 'title': 'Bug 7330Make more actions available on text selection', 'description': 'Bug 7330Make more actions available on text selection I could not find the action "Add Javadoc Comment" until I switched to theOutline view. in the Edit (or some other global) menuI think currently we distribute the actions on a personal taste basis. Thisshould be changed. It is not clear to users why some actions are in the contextmenu and some are not (OKnot all need to be in the context menu but all mustbe reachable from the editor e.g. It is not acceptable to forceusers to switch the view. ', 'OB': 'in the context menu and if not2. ', 'EB': 'I expected the action to be1. ', 'SR': ''}
